description: This course integrates advanced pathophysiology and clinical implications for graduate nursing students. Recent scientific advances will be discussed with application to new approaches to disease and symptom management. The interrelationships between clinical pathophysiology and basic physiology and genetics are emphasized.
name: ADVANCED PHYSIOLOGY AND PATHOPHYSIOLOGY

values.comments:
Nursing 607 integrates advanced pathophysiology and clinical implications for graduate nursing students. Recent scientific advances will be discussed with application to new approaches to disease and symptom management. The interrelationships between clinical pathophysiology and basic physiology and genetics are emphasized. 

Comments concerning this class were generally positive, with most students complimenting the interesting subject matter. Several students wrote that this was the best course they had taken at Penn. Many students also enjoyed that the class, while requiring a lot of work, did not have any busy work. Another common note was that students felt that they learned a lot from the class. Students generally felt that this course would help them in the future, with many suggesting that all BSN candidates should take it. Additionally, many students felt that this course should be split into two semesters to accommodate the vast amount of material covered.

Several students complimented Professor Tkacs’ approachability and teaching methods. One student wrote that she would love to take more classes on pathophysiology with Professor Tkacs.

Students generally thought that the course required a lot of work and reading, but that the payoff in terms of knowledge was worth it. Several students commented that they learned a lot of things that they could see applications for already. Some students felt that the recitation readings, while interesting, were underdeveloped in that there were no assignments or testing that covered them. This led to many students not completing the recitation readings. Overall, students thought that the course was difficult but was worth the challenge.
